Block sampling

Source: R/blocksample.R
blocksample.Rd

Sample blockwise from clustered data

blocksample(data, size, idvar = NULL, replace = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

data

Data frame

size

Size of samples

idvar

Column defining the clusters

replace

Logical indicating wether to sample with replacement

...

additional arguments to lower level functions

Value

data.frame

Details

Original id is stored in the attribute 'id'

Author

Klaus K. Holst

Examples


d <- data.frame(x=rnorm(5), z=rnorm(5), id=c(4,10,10,5,5), v=rnorm(5))
(dd <- blocksample(d,size=20,~id))
#>              x           z id           v
#> 1    0.6515508 -0.08546577  1 -0.58259682
#> 4    1.3676784  0.42307003  2  1.01936198
#> 5   -0.3340564 -0.15699879  2 -1.18239867
#> 4.1  1.3676784  0.42307003  3  1.01936198
#> 5.1 -0.3340564 -0.15699879  3 -1.18239867
#> 4.2  1.3676784  0.42307003  4  1.01936198
#> 5.2 -0.3340564 -0.15699879  4 -1.18239867
#> 2   -0.3702544 -0.30782623  5 -1.34872702
#> 3   -0.6877916 -0.24959170  5 -0.05597874
#> 2.1 -0.3702544 -0.30782623  6 -1.34872702
#> 3.1 -0.6877916 -0.24959170  6 -0.05597874
#> 1.1  0.6515508 -0.08546577  7 -0.58259682
#> 1.2  0.6515508 -0.08546577  8 -0.58259682
#> 2.2 -0.3702544 -0.30782623  9 -1.34872702
#> 3.2 -0.6877916 -0.24959170  9 -0.05597874
#> 4.3  1.3676784  0.42307003 10  1.01936198
#> 5.3 -0.3340564 -0.15699879 10 -1.18239867
#> 2.3 -0.3702544 -0.30782623 11 -1.34872702
#> 3.3 -0.6877916 -0.24959170 11 -0.05597874
#> 1.3  0.6515508 -0.08546577 12 -0.58259682
#> 4.4  1.3676784  0.42307003 13  1.01936198
#> 5.4 -0.3340564 -0.15699879 13 -1.18239867
#> 4.5  1.3676784  0.42307003 14  1.01936198
#> 5.5 -0.3340564 -0.15699879 14 -1.18239867
#> 2.4 -0.3702544 -0.30782623 15 -1.34872702
#> 3.4 -0.6877916 -0.24959170 15 -0.05597874

#> 1.4  0.6515508 -0.08546577 19 -0.58259682

attributes(dd)$id
#>  [1]  4  5  5  5  5  5  5 10 10 10 10  4  4 10 10  5  5 10 10  4  5  5  5  5 10
#> [26] 10  5  5  5  5 10 10  4  4

if (FALSE) {
blocksample(data.table::data.table(d),1e6,~id)
}


d <- data.frame(x=c(1,rnorm(9)),
               z=rnorm(10),
               id=c(4,10,10,5,5,4,4,5,10,5),
               id2=c(1,1,2,1,2,1,1,1,1,2),
               v=rnorm(10))
dsample(d,~id, size=2)
#>              x          z id id2          v id.1
#> 1   1.00000000 -0.2107349  4   1 -1.2914616    1
#> 6   0.07917624 -0.5106671  4   1  0.5681323    1
#> 7   0.62380396  0.2329920  4   1 -0.1173081    1
#> 1.1 1.00000000 -0.2107349  4   1 -1.2914616    2
#> 6.1 0.07917624 -0.5106671  4   1  0.5681323    2
#> 7.1 0.62380396  0.2329920  4   1 -0.1173081    2
dsample(d,.~id+id2)
#>                x             z          v id
#> 2    -0.70753423 -0.0002093489 -0.4737932  1
#> 9     0.04867336  1.6398377505 -0.3436505  1
#> 1     1.00000000 -0.2107348582 -1.2914616  2
#> 6     0.07917624 -0.5106670841  0.5681323  2
#> 7     0.62380396  0.2329920366 -0.1173081  2
#> 4     1.27720232  0.4828013914  1.5203987  3
#> 8     1.07298910  0.2900394106  2.0206699  3
#> 4.1   1.27720232  0.4828013914  1.5203987  4
#> 8.1   1.07298910  0.2900394106  2.0206699  4
#> 1.1   1.00000000 -0.2107348582 -1.2914616  5
#> 6.1   0.07917624 -0.5106670841  0.5681323  5
#> 7.1   0.62380396  0.2329920366 -0.1173081  5
#> 5     0.39076980  1.5996968783 -0.1987655  6
#> 10   -1.95003384  0.2812723546 -0.5816981  6
#> 5.1   0.39076980  1.5996968783 -0.1987655  7
#> 10.1 -1.95003384  0.2812723546 -0.5816981  7
#> 2.1  -0.70753423 -0.0002093489 -0.4737932  8
#> 9.1   0.04867336  1.6398377505 -0.3436505  8
#> 5.2   0.39076980  1.5996968783 -0.1987655  9
#> 10.2 -1.95003384  0.2812723546 -0.5816981  9
#> 1.2   1.00000000 -0.2107348582 -1.2914616 10
#> 6.2   0.07917624 -0.5106670841  0.5681323 10
#> 7.2   0.62380396  0.2329920366 -0.1173081 10
dsample(d,x+z~id|x>0,size=5)
#>              x          z id
#> 3   1.29961442 -0.6318359  1
#> 9   0.04867336  1.6398378  1
#> 3.1 1.29961442 -0.6318359  2
#> 9.1 0.04867336  1.6398378  2
#> 4   1.27720232  0.4828014  3
#> 5   0.39076980  1.5996969  3
#> 8   1.07298910  0.2900394  3
#> 4.1 1.27720232  0.4828014  4
#> 5.1 0.39076980  1.5996969  4
#> 8.1 1.07298910  0.2900394  4
#> 4.2 1.27720232  0.4828014  5
#> 5.2 0.39076980  1.5996969  5
#> 8.2 1.07298910  0.2900394  5
